divs: sighting detailsat approx 2251 hrs on 5\09\10, i walked outside to let my dog out and as i always do i looked up to the night sky to see the stars. i noticed two small dots of light moving slowly from the the south to the north at a medium speed. both objects were directly in line with the other, i initially thought they might be low orbiting satalites but as i watched it appeared as if the second dot of light was being "towed" (for lack of a better word) by the first. the first dot of light would move, then a half second to second later the second dot of light would move. i turned around, went back inside to get my wife and turn off the patio light to see better. once we both were back outside i observed both objects make a gradiual left turn and start moving to the northeast and watched as i lost sight of them. i initially thought i lost sight of them due to the lighting conditions but now believe i lost sight due to them gaining in altitude. after losing sight of them i continued to watch the ne sky to see if i could observe anything else. after approx five minutes i noticed a bright star like object in the ne sky become brighter (like a shooting star bright) and move from the ne to the north in a short eratic movement then disappear. i continued watching the night sky for another 20-30 minutes but did not observe anything else. i live with in five miles of the huntsville\madison airport and 10 miles of redstone arsenal. i have never seen what i witness last night before, i am not saying it\they were alien ufo's, i am reporting what i observed to see if others reported the same or aid in additional investigations.
Summary: I observed 2 star-like high flying objects move from south to north in a medium speed, then turn left towards the northeast. As I watched it appeared as if the second one was being towed by the first. I lost sight then saw bright flash
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Madison
There were no other sightings in Madison on or around May 9th 2010
